event: Early modern humans inhabit regions of present-day France
Celtic Gaulish tribes dominate much of the territory
Julius Caesar completes the Roman conquest of Gaul
Roman Gaul becomes a major center of Roman culture and infrastructure
Roman authority collapses during barbarian invasions
Clovis unites the Franks, laying foundations of the French state
Charlemagne is crowned Emperor, ruling much of Western Europe
Treaty of Verdun divides the Carolingian Empire, shaping France’s core territory
Hugh Capet becomes king, founding the Capetian dynasty
Gothic architecture emerges, transforming cathedrals and cities
French monarchy defeats rivals, consolidating royal power
Hundred Years’ War begins between France and England
Joan of Arc rallies French forces during the Hundred Years’ War
Hundred Years’ War ends, strengthening the French monarchy
French Renaissance flourishes under royal patronage
Wars of Religion erupt between Catholics and Protestants
Edict of Nantes grants limited religious tolerance
Louis XIV begins reign, embodying absolute monarchy
Versailles becomes the royal court and symbol of royal power
French Revolution begins, overturning the old regime
Monarchy is abolished and the king is executed
Napoleon Bonaparte seizes power in a coup
Napoleon crowns himself Emperor of the French
Napoleon is defeated and monarchy is restored
July Revolution reshapes constitutional monarchy
Franco-Prussian War leads to collapse of the Second Empire
Third Republic is established after national defeat
France enters World War I as a major Allied power
World War I ends with massive losses and territorial recovery
France is defeated and partially occupied by Nazi Germany
Liberation of France restores national sovereignty
Fifth Republic is established under Charles de Gaulle
Algerian War ends, closing the French colonial empire era
